Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays

Class GrowableCharArray<T extends GrowableCharArray<?>>

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays.GrowableCharArray<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.CharSequence
Direct Known Subclasses:
InOutGrowableCharArray
public class GrowableCharArray<T extends GrowableCharArray<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.CharSequence, java.lang.Appendable

This class implements functionality for the growable character arrays. It also inplements CharSequence interface and can be used everywhere this interface required

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

  • Constructor Details

    • GrowableCharArray

      public GrowableCharArray​(boolean usePlain)

      Create growable char array instance

      Parameters:
      usePlain - true if you want to use plain array for data keeping. When true, the functionality of the class is similar to the ByteArrayOutputStream class. Using 'false' reduces the memory used, but slow down access time

    • GrowableCharArray

      public GrowableCharArray​(boolean usePlain, int initialPow)

      Create growable char array instance

      Parameters:
      usePlain - true if you want to use plain array for data keeping. When true, the functionality of the class is similar to the ByteArrayOutputStream class. Using 'false' reduces the memory used, but slow down access time
      initialPow - 2^^initialPow is a piece size of the growable array.

    • append

      public T append​(char[] data, int from, int to) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Append data to the end of array

      Parameters:
      data - data to append
      from - start position in the data to append
      to - end position in the data to append (excluding self)
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when data reference is null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when from and to indices out of data

      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - on any null parameters

    • append

      public T append​(SyntaxTreeInterface<?> tree, long id) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Append name from syntax tree to the end of array

      Parameters:
      tree - tree to add name from
      id - name id in the tree
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when tree is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when tree doesn't contain name with the given id
      Since:
      0.0.4

    • read

      public int read​(int index, char[] target) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Read a piece of data from the given index

      Parameters:
      index - array index to get data from
      target - place to store data to
      Returns:
      real data size got
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when target reference is null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when index outside the data

    • read

      public int read​(int index, char[] target, int from, int to) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Read a piece of data from the given index

      Parameters:
      index - array index to get data from
      target - place to store data to
      from - start position to get data to
      to - start position to get data to (excluding self)
      Returns:
      real data size gotten
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when target reference is null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when index outside the data or from and to indices outside the target

    • toPlain

      public T toPlain()

      Convert internal array from sliced to plain form. Speeds up performance, but increase memory to store data

      Returns:
      self if the array was still plain, otherwise new cloned instance with the plain data array

    • toArray

      public char[] toArray()

      Convert internal data to array.

      Returns:
      internal array 'as-is' for plain or clone of the data

    • extract

      public char[] extract()

      Returns:
      array content copy
      Since:
      0.0.2

    • clear

      public void clear()

      Clear array content

    • getReader

      public java.io.Reader getReader()

      Create reader based on the array. Reader doesn't change array content and/or state. Any number of the readers can be opened on the same array simultaneously. You must not change array content while reader is opened

      Returns:
      reader to get content of the char array. Can be empty but not null
      Since:
      0.0.2
